result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Hugh Krosinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay restitution of $1,093.44 and restitution surcharge of $109.34.  Bond to be applied to restitution first and then to costs.
First 60 days without Huber - remaining time with Huber if he qualifies.

No contact with victim or her family.

Defendant to undergo a sex offender assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.   

Comply with any no contacts, conditions or assessments ordered by agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: First 60 days without Huber - remaining time with Huber if he qualifies.
